dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed inside plate): 27.2 × 19.7 cm (10 11/16 × 7 3/4 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings:
Collector stamp and date in brown ink, verso upper center: P. Mariette II (Lugt 1789) 1694

Collector stamp in black ink, verso lower left: A. Hubert (Lugt 130)
inscribed:
In margin around oval: IVLIVS CAESAR SCALIGER.  AET. IXXIIII. AN. M.D.LVIII

Inscribed and signed in cartouche, lower center: Expressus plumbo fuerat .. hunc Goltzius artifici.

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Pierre II Mariette [1634-1716, Lugt 1789]. Alfred Gabriel Hubert [1831-1908, Lugt 130]; sale of his collection, Paris, May 25-29, 1909, lot 289; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
